name: C. The Child and Toy
statement:
On Children’s Day, the child got a toy from Delayyy as a present.
However, the child is so naughty that he can’t wait to destroy the
toy.The toy consists of parts and ropes. Each rope links two parts, but
every pair of parts is linked by at most one rope. To split the toy, the
child must remove all its parts. The child can remove a single part at a
time, and each remove consume an energy. Let’s define an energy value of
part as . The child spend energy for removing part where are the parts
that are directly connected to the -th and haven’t been removed.Help the
child to find out, what is the minimum total energy he should spend to
remove all parts.
editorial:
The best way to delete all n nodes is deleting them in decreasing order
of their value. Proof: Consider each edge , it will contribute to the
total cost or when it is deleted. If we delete the vertices in
decreasing order, then it will contribute only , so the total costs is
the lowest.
